intro: Alcea loftusii, commonly known as the desert holly, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, violet to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Alcea loftusii is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
